name: Mercure Parma Stendhal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very good comfortable stay in the centre of Parma. Good sized double room, very quiet. Excellent buffet breakfast. Well managed hotel with helpful and friendly staff on hand. Would recommend it.
reviews.title: very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is pretty much perfect, 5 minutes from the train station and right next to the huge art gallery, and the rest of Parmas historic center.
reviews.title: Very good choice in Parma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was nice and above average size, felt like it had been renovated fairly recently. Good breakfast buffet, well above Italian standard.
reviews.title: Good Experience, and the Breakfast !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free wifi, quiet room and a view out over an old church rounded of a nice weekend stay
reviews.title: Modern hotel in the heart of Parma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Parma is compact and the hotel is located within easy walking distance of the railroad station, restaurants, and major sights: the Duomo, Baptistry, and the Gallery Nazionale in the Palazzo della Pilotta. Our room was reasonably large (by Italian standards), clean, comfortable bed, and well equipped bathroom. Front-desk people were knowledgable, and the breakfast... fresh persimmons through meats and eggs...possibly the best in many trips to Italy. We are light sleepers but heard little noise from adjacent rooms. However, the locals gathered under an arcade across the street, were a nuisance.They have nothing better to do than yell as loudly as possible. Also, though the station is only 3-4 blocks away, finding the hotel can be difficult. Anyone arriving by rail should consult Google directions so as not to get lost.
reviews.title: A good value centrally located hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a real first class hotel. Everything is elegant and tasteful. Our room (166) had a great balcony and was so easy to get to - just walk up the stairs if we didn't feel like taking the elevator. Great wi-ti, new flatscreen, double vanity spotless bathroom (although the shower pressure was very weak.
reviews.title: sorry we didn't stay longer - wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the front door, you are only across the road from the entrance to the archaeological museum, which we really enjoyed (closed on Monday), 4 euros. When you leave the museum, turn left, walk across the small bridge and you'll find yourself in a beautiful park similar to the tree lined parks of Paris. The town itself is beautiful.
reviews.title: good, recommendable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Don't expect good bread here - it's pretty bad -dry and tasteless - no butter served along side.
reviews.title: Stendhal in the heart of Parma - walking distance to EVERYTHING!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm sorry, I digress.
reviews.title: Great location, clean but hard beds!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was plentiful, and the coffee was strong. They even froth the milk you get with it. Now that's going the extra mile.
reviews.title: All around great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010
reviews.text: It was the luck of the draw that we were allocated a very good room as some others in our party found theirs on the small side, but that apart there was nothing serious to complain about during our 6 night stay based in this hotel though, if you tried, it would be easy to carp (shower cubicle too small, inadequate plug in the bathroom washbasin etc etc) Very easy walking distance to all the sights and sites of Parma. Not the most generous of buffet breakfasts, but more than adequate. A good average place for a short stay.
reviews.title: Convieniently positioned and perfectly comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I cannot understand why this hotel doesn't get better press. The location is as good as it gets in this pleasant provincial northern italian city. You can walk everywhere from here. Thankfully the hotel has (paid) parking since the centre of the cuty is pedestrianised. The breakfast is excellent and the staff make an effort to help, even with young children. Finally, the quality price ratio is very good.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Parma

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Free internet.
reviews.title: A Very Reliable Choice in Parma!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am the sort of person who usually plans a holiday trip well in advance, at least 5-6 months in advance. However, when opportunity strikes and I am able to come one day earlier to Italy for our wedding anniversary celebrations/year end break, it didn't take me too long to decide to come to Parma and stay at this gem of a Hotel.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, ideally located for city centre, excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mauro from Reservations was most prompt and cordial in answering my numerous queries about Junior suites and Double rooms available in the Hotel. As we normally would stay in Junior suites, I had opted for a higher floor, back facing Double room here to recover from our jet lag. Another reason being, the Junior suites at the Hotel Stendhal are front facing, and located on the first floor, which is directly above the reception area, each with its own covered outside porch.
reviews.title: Very good location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night on business. Its very central and across from a lovely part of town. The old buildings across the road have a market in them on some days. The reception was very professional and friendly. The rooms are in good condition with a great shower. Had a late night drink and although the barman was moody and full of attitude it made me enjoy the G&T even more.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms and great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast is good with every choice you could need, and the coffee is good and strong. One tip is the lift opens on both sides so don't face the way you got in the lift and wonder why the doors are not opening as I did.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, clean, well-appointed rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Good value hotel as well
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here on a tour of Emilio-Romagna. The location is great - close to the center of town, and the rooms were clean, good beds, large (by European standards) and nicely-furnished. The breakfast offered a wide variety of foods, both traditional breakfast food as well as Italian favorites - meats, cheeses. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Ideal central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the edge of historical centre. It's easy to find by car and there is a good place to stop and unload luggage. The hotel's underground parking is good.
reviews.title: Perfect location

description: The 4-star Mercure Parma Stendhal is located in the heart of the old town, opposite the Palazzo della Pilotta and just 328 yds (300 m) from the station, and serves an extensive buffet breakfast. Rooms are furnished with wooden period furniture and have TV with cable channels and free WIFI. The hotel is 437 yds (400 m) from the cathedral, a 5-minute walk from the European Food Safety Authority headquarters and approx. 10 mins' drive from the airport. An onsite car park is available subject to availability.
